title: How to Bug a Room With Bluetooth

steps.title: Seriously reconsider.
steps.content: Seriously reconsider. Eavesdropping is rude! But if you just have to do it, continue.

steps.title: Turn on your Bluetooth headset.
steps.content: Turn on your Bluetooth headset. Make sure it is paired with your phone, and that the battery is reasonably fresh.

steps.title: Hide the Bluetooth headset somewhere in the room where it will be able to pick up sounds clearly, but make sure that it is well hidden.
steps.content: Hide the Bluetooth headset somewhere in the room where it will be able to pick up sounds clearly, but make sure that it is well hidden.

steps.title: Leave the room, but don't go too far; your Bluetooth connection should work through walls, but if you get too far away, it won't work very well.
steps.content: Leave the room, but don't go too far; your Bluetooth connection should work through walls, but if you get too far away, it won't work very well. The range is about 30 feet, or 10 metres.

steps.title: Wait for the conversation of interest to start.
steps.content: Wait for the conversation of interest to start. When it does, turn on the voice recorder on your phone. It should record through the microphone of the Bluetooth headset.

steps.title: At the end of the conversation, stop recording.
steps.content: At the end of the conversation, stop recording. If the phone stops recording automatically after a while, you may need to start it again. Retrieve the headset and play back at your leisure.

steps.title: Optionally, use a microphone and Audacity, a free, open-source audio recording application, to dub the conversation to your PC.
steps.content: Optionally, use a microphone and Audacity, a free, open-source audio recording application, to dub the conversation to your PC. From there it can be emailed, or burned onto a CD.
